intro: Artanthe andicola, commonly known as the Andean artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. Artanthe andicola is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat.
